content: I didn't find any option on the website to get in touch nor in the app. But AutoHue freezes very often when executed, it's completely random, sometimes it takes 30s to go back, or just crash the app.. And in the mean time the execution keeps hanged, like blink the light and it doesn't turn it off, or setting up to change colors and increase brightness and it executes one and freezes for a while and continue the process. I tried everything, even simple command keeps freezing. I'm upset =/
Works wonderfully on the Pixel 3XL, Android 11! The tutorials on YouTube are very helpful. Super impressed!
needs update. not enough reliability or options
replyContent:
Hi Troy,

Sorry to hear your missing those features, they are however also not mentioned in the app description. That said the reason these features are not there is because their is no 'signal' from the hue bridge when these events are triggered. So there is actually no proper way for the app to know about these events. Hope that clarifies things.

content: Has something changes on this app? Used to work great but today none of my hue tasks are working
App abandoned? This app no longer appears to work on the latest Android release. Hasn't been updated since 2018?
Doesn't work on Pixel 3a. All actions/tasks fail even when you've manually had to locate the bridge etc. Useless waste of time
Works on Pixel 2 in Android 10 with Philips Hue Bridge 2.1 - but had to manually add the bridge's IP
Crashed tasker
Works perfectly, Fantastic! Thank you.
Currently broken with latest Hue update
Please add option to hide app icon, thanks!
Used to work great. Now doesn't work at all! Task throws an error on the first action in the task. Back to using the Hue app.
So far I am very pleased with this.  Combined with tasker, it gives you VERY strong control over your lights.

I should have updated my review long ago, but this plugin continues to be amazing, and the fact that it works locally (and if you use autoremote remotely)  I use this plugin for a lot of my automation involving lights instead of other means.
replyContent: Hi Dayne, Thanks for your feedback. I plan to implement remote support as soon as Philips opens up that api to all developers. Enjoy.

content: worked well to turn my lights on when home...dev very helpful

Perfect app for Macrodroid or Tasker. Gives full functionality and ability 
to create fully automated tasks with much more functionality than the 
simple Lifx app. Good replacement for the shotty dusk dawn function in the 
Lifx app.
Stopped working
Doesn't work when ran from Tasker. Battery optimization is turned off and it does work when it is run in the app itself. Used to work for me a while too
The recent update introduced long missing features, looks neat and works nicely
Great plugin for tasker! Too bad the Hue API only allows to connect with local WiFi but that is something that Philips has to change.
Everything you need to automate every aspect of you hue lighting setup. Great plugin.
The new UI is great, works perfectly
Does what it says it does
Great
Broken now for Hue.
replyContent:
Hi David,
I've updated AutoHue quite a bit since you've last used it. Hopefully this also fixes the issues you were having. Otherwise please report them by mail as well so that I can get you up and running!
Cheers, Rob

content: It's a fantastic app! The update recent to 1.08 ruined some things in Lifx. Before, when you pick anything, for example Breathe, pick a colour. It will then ask you what brightness you want. Then you get this line: Hue: 300 Saturation:1.00 brightness:1.00. Giving you total control to fine tune if needed. Now since the update, that is gone. Pick a colour and you're given a hexadecimal value. That means you can't choose saturation and brightness. Only way to do that is type that whole like yourself. Please fix it so we can get that full control back. And also add the ability to choose groups. Then it will get 5 stars! Otherwise thank you for the great app!
Lifx stopped working with latest update. Only toggle command works
replyContent:
Hi Brandon,

I just gave the LIFX (& AutoHue) part a big overhaul. You can now select the Lifx 2.0 action within tasker. Hopefully this fixes some of the issues you ran into earlier. Otherwise feel free to contact me by mail so that I can hopefully get you up and running!

Cheers, Rob

content: RECENT UPDATE HAS BROKEN THIS APP FOR LIFX , PLease fix :)
I used to use with my lifx globes but haven't used it in a while. Does it still support lifx? What do I put in the ip address field. Needs more simple tutorials
replyContent:
Hi Jack,

When connecting it to your Lifx lights make sure you select the 'Lifx 2.0' action in tasker. Then all you need to do is provide your cloud token (there should be an info bubble next to this field to help) to get up and running.

Cheers, Rob

content: I cannot get this app to work. In I created a task with a command for Autohue, and it would not work. I have not gotten it to work even once. When I test it in the config scene, it works fine. I have heard that this is a battery optimization issue. However, when I go to Settings - battery - optimization, there is no Autohue. I have no more recourse.
replyContent:
Hey Daniel,
Sorry to hear you're having issues. Please contact me by mail (email in the play store page), so I can hopefully help you to get up and running!

content: It sometimes just doesn't work...
replyContent: Hey Man, sorry to hear you are having issues. There are some known issues with AutoHue and Android 6+ (Doze Mode). This can be fixed by disabling "battery optimization" for both Tasker & AutoHue in the Android system settings. Hope that helps!

content: Almost never works. I trigger the tasks from my watch, but almost every time I have to open tasker, go to edit the task, and test the lights once for things to work. It stops working again after a while.
replyContent: Hi Casper, this is likely due to the 'battery optimization' feature introduced in Android marshmallow. If you go into the Android system settings->battery->battery optimization and there DISABLE battery optimization for both tasker and Autohue I think that should solve your problems. If not, feel free to contact me by mail! Cheers, Rob

content: Excellent for controlling my Hue system with Tasker. One request would be to be able to fetch the "ct" variable (colour temperature for white Ambiance bulbs) from the state check function, but otherwise this + Tasker does everything the Hue app can't.
Can't adjust brightness or allow for custom json for lifx bulbs.
Could not get this to work on tasker.
replyContent:
Hi Joe, 
Sorry to hear you're having some issues getting up and running. If you still haven't figured it out or having problems feel free to contact me by mail. 

Cheers, Rob

content: In the plugin UI, it will show the hue state and all variables prefectly, but when run in a task, the app ALWAYS receives "null" or "undefined" for all variables when trying through a local WiFi network :/ It works when connecting remotely. I RALLY wish this feature would work properly...
replyContent: Hey Tony, sorry to hear you're having some problems with the hue state plugin. And really weird it's working remotely but not locally (the other way around would make more sense). You should however use a different ip adress when connecting locally then remotely, could that be causing your issue?

content: Any instructions on how to use auto hue ?? Help please
replyContent: Hi hiewy, I've written some basic tutorials in the blog section on www.cuberob.com e.g. Good morning with Autohue. That should get you started! Cheers, Rob

content: Being able to control my lights from my Samsung Gear S3 watch is awesome!
I have many Hue lights spread across three bridges. This is the only solution I've found that enables me to manage all the bridges together. Essential for my setup.
User friendly, works instantly, easy to setup. Its the kind of plugin you forget until you get a new phone and wonder why your stuff isn't working anymore.
Good work
Works perfectly
Love being able to control my lights via Tasker. I remember a few niggles when setting up my tasks, but I can't remember what they were now.
Good app. Would be great if I could use existing scenes.

I am unable to set lights to a custom JSON string using a variable. I tried to back up the current configuration to a variable then restore it by setting the lights to that variable, but nothing happens.
replyContent: Hey dubz, that feature should already be supported. On www.cuberob.com in the blog section I've written a tutorial (e.g. Good morning with Autohue) that should get you started. Cheers, Rob

content: Works great. I'd love to be able to pass in Tasker variables though, for example a brightness setting. But until then, it's working as intended!
Always just works. Would go 5 star if there was a toggle+brightness+color option, instead of toggle being alone, and power+color+brightness being their own

Great app, easily my most used Tasker plugin!    Had an initial issue which turned out to be my phone but the dev was very helpful and prompt.    The app gives you everything you could want, love the custom JSON functionality!
Excellent app, though I would like to see the ability to set the brightness or color to a Tasker variable.
Crashing constantly
replyContent: Hi Andrew, Sorry to hear it is crashing. By crashing do you mean "stops working in BG"? If so please disable battery optimization for autohue if you are running Android Marshmellow. (From within the battery settings) this should solve the issue. Otherwise please contact me by mail so I can help you out! Cheers, Rob

content: My favorite use - purple and red flashing during and alarm, which once dismissed causes a 10 second transition to a cool wakeup color.
Please add Osram Lightify. They are the only full color recessed bulb kit on the market. Thanks in advance
come find out it for automating Christmas lights or sumthin. Boy what a waste, got no use for this  crap!
replyContent: Hi Shane, I'm a little confused by your review. Is it not working for you? Or did you expect something completely different? Please feel free to contact me by mail so I can help you out. Cheers, Rob

content: I use it with Automate and it works like a charm:-)
When will Lifx brightness control be added? Similar to custom JSON? Thanks
Overall is good. Use blinking lights for incoming call and green solid light for received text.
Group support? Getting scenes from the bridge?
Love automating stuff with tasker, auto hue just adds to it. Wish there was a way to add color to blinks...right now it just blinks white if I set it to that
Great Plugin. Works really well with all my original LIFX's. Doesn't work with my Color-1000 though for some reason.
Would like option to control groups of lights. At least expose the light names field to the custom json string so we can send the group names ourselves... Thanks

In the last couple of weeks this plugin has been hit and miss when it comes to working. Logging in tasker showed it kicks off to change the lights and plugin returns OK.  Pressing play on an autohue action in tasker runs for a few mins and nothing happens. Editing the action and hitting test command works.  UPDATE: its been working for the last week as expected. Back to 5 stars!
The only thing I really wish it had that the hue app has is a fade feature
Now the app works perfectly again! Great active developer!
replyContent: Hi Adam, Sorry to hear about your issues, this is most likely due to Android 6s new battery optimization. Please disable it for autohue (from within the battery settings) this should solve the issue. Otherwise please contact me by mail so I can help you out! Cheers, Rob

content: It is possible to control hue from the internet if I port forward but this app doesn't accept alternative ports other than port 80
replyContent: Hi Chris, currently I indeed only support communication over port 80. Since philips hasn't opened their API for remote access I decided to keep it like that. Please note that in the app description I state that I officially only support lights on the local network. Once Philips opens up the remote access APIs I am planning to support them! Cheers

content: Make sure to take it off battery optimisation, otherwise it won't work when triggered in background.

When setting up tasks, and for a while after it works perfectly. But after a longer period (2hr?) It doesn't seem to connect properly so state isn't retrieved and command/tasks aren't preformed. It starts working again immediately if I test a task.
replyContent: Hi Gerard, Most likely those issues are due to Android 6s new battery optimization. So if you are running Android 6 please disable battery optimization (from system settings) for both autohue and tasker. if this doesn't help please contact me by mail so I can help you out. Cheers, Rob

content: Good customization options, but it would be nice if it could detect the Hue hub automatically.  My tasks stop working when ever there's a power outage or the hub is restarted.  The LifX portion doesn't seem to work at all, even after copying in an API key from the website.  It just gets stuck looking for bulbs.  There's another Tasker LiFX plugin that doesn't require any logging in or copying API keys from websites, but it doesn't let me set transition times or more complicated features.
replyContent:
Hi Kellin,

To fix your issue with the Hue bridge changing IP you could set it to have a static address, this is easily done from the official hue app by going into settings -> my bridge -> network settings and then disabling DHCP.

content: Fails to detect lifx bulbs - token is correct. Waste of time
replyContent: Hi Andrew, sorry you feel this way and failed to set it up correctly. Please don't hesitate to contact me by mail and I will try to help you to get set up and running!

content: Than huepro with huepro-tasker plugin.
Contacted the developer about an error in the descriptions and received a reply the same day, haven't tested yet but am confident it will work
Great stuff. I wish there was a way to pass variables to the Plugin though. I want to set brightness go a variable i set in tasker is this possible ?!

Tasker, coupled with this plugin, is all you need to control your Hues. So many possibilities for the advanced user! My favourite trick is to set the color within the blue‚Äìwhite‚Äìred spectrum to indicate how cold/hot it is outside in the morning. The future is here!
this is a great app. I miss an option to make groups of lamps though.

I had to reboot my router and I noticed the bridge IP changed. I opened auto hue and there is no setting to update to the new IP.  I opened tasker and found it in my tasks but why doesn't it update on its own.  So now I have to go into each individual task and update the IP...  There should be an easier way to do this.
replyContent: Hi Andrew, in the official hue app you can go into settings -> my bridge -> network settings and here disable DHCP, this way the IP of your bridge will not change and thus you should no longer have this problem. Good luck!

content: Selecting individual lights on turns all on. Renders app useless.
replyContent: Hi Math, sorry to hear you are having problems. Could you contact me via the support email so we can solve your issue? Thanks!

content: Thanks for providing a first-class tasker plugin for Philipps Hue.

If you bought HUE lights, you need this app! This app alone is worth buying tasker for. Your HUE experience is incomplete without Autohue.  Now with even more! Two additional stars for latest updates! +‚òÜ‚òÜ Keep the updates coming!
replyContent: Hi Daniel, Thanks for reporting your colorloop issues. Will look into it for the next update!

content: Adding transition times and hue states has given me even more control of my lights, awesome plugin!
Crashes constantly.   When it does work,  color is nowhere near what I chose

Bravo for adding the Toggle option. Is it possible to have an action to increase/decrease the brightness of a bulb gradually over a set time period? The built-in gradual alarm in the Hue app has limited customization options. Really wish there was a way to control Hue outside the WiFi network...

Tried other options to control the Philips Hue lights with Tasker but this just makes it so much easier. Want that 5th star, just add in transition time and it'll be everything I need.   I know it's an issue with the api but for those that need it i worked around the local only issue by setting up a vpn connection to my home network
Works for me as advertised
Just what I wanted for tasker! Got it all set up on one device but no matter what I try on my old phone it doesn't work except in the config settings :(
Exactly what I needed.

This app has enabled me to move away from using email triggers in IFTTT, which are ridiculously unreliable. This app works perfectly and triggers my lights instantly. Got around the having to be on home network by having a second phone at home and using autoremote.  I can still turn lights on when I am approaching my house and make sure they turn off after I leave.
I Love this. Just brought my Home Animation to a whole new Level! Perfect!
Would need only a fade option for total automation. EG.: in the morning gradually turn on my bedroom light over the time of 10 minutes

This works great! However, it would be nice if the app was able to query the variables that the lights presently have. That way you could toggle between different modes very easily by storing a variable as what the light is now, then switch it to something you want with an nfc or profile, then switch back to the previous state or variable.  Does anyone have any good ideas on how to achieve this?
Works a treat!
I have had issues with lights not being set. Please fix!
replyContent: Hi Beau, sorry to hear that. However I'm not sure what is causing your issue as the "send command" part is not altered in this update, but it might be some edge case I haven't covered. Could you please contact me by mail so we can further debug your issue? Thanks for your feedback!

content: Thanks for the toggle option

It works brilliantly, and with no delay. Having a Tasker plugin for my lighting has opened up a whole new realm of possibilities. I'm especially liking the fact that I can choose which lights to include in various commands, so that I can easily exclude the lights in other rooms of the house. There is so much I can do with this, and I've only just barely gotten started.
One of my essentials! Excellent work! Thank you!
Works great.

Lampshade hasn't been working so well lately with tasker, so I decided to try this app. The commands work instantly, which is great because I have a scene in tasker I use to control my lights and now I don't have to spam the buttons for the lights to all change. Also works faster when I am using pebbletasker as opposed to Lampshade.  Great settings, have some alarms set too, and lamp flashing when my phone rings (though it would be nice if you added a Constant blink, since there is a cancel blink action, so I don't have to loop the 30 second one if I want a constant).

I'm not an expert in Tasker or anything, so I was a little worried I wouldn't be able to make this work, but in 5 minutes I combined NFC ReTag with Tasker and this little app to make my lights go on and off just by touching my phone to a tag! Solved my biggest annoyance with Hue, which was having to open the app to turn lights on and off. Now my phone works like a switch, and I'm a happier person for it. Simple to use, does exactly what it promises. Worth every cent. Thanks!

Nice plugin, does exactly what I need it to do.  A couple suggestions, unfortunately this is ugly because the store won't let me format how I like:  1. Add a way to set the "transitiontime" parameter which controls fading/etc, we can work around this with custom JSON but that defeats the purpose of the nice UI. 2. Consider fixing the "Succes" spelling as shown in the screenshots. Although I realize English isn't your first language, showcasing such a simple flaw will make potential customers skeptical. =)
The previous version had two minor issues, one not being able to group lights. The new update solves this. Perfect plugin for a perfect app (Tasker)
replyContent: Met de laatste update is het nu ook mogelijk om de lampen in te delen. Problemen bij het versturen ligt vaak aan de wifi verbinding, mocht je echt problemen ondervinden, neem gerust contact op!

content: Thank you for adding variable support for custom JSON! This is now exactly the tasker/hue app that I've been waiting for someone to make. Love it!
Pretty good!
